Module net.etf.project
Package net.etf.project.model.rental

Class Rental

java.lang.Object
net.etf.project.model.rental.Rental
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Rental extends Object implements Runnable
This class represents a rental transaction for a vehicle, tracking details such as the rental date, user information, vehicle ID, and the movement of the vehicle from start to end location on a simulated map. Implements Runnable to allow vehicle movement simulation in a separate thread.

  • Constructor Details

    • Rental

      public Rental(Date rentalDateTime, String userName, String rentalVehicleId, Location startLocation, Location endLocation, double rentalDuration, boolean hasMalfunction, boolean hasPromotion)
      Constructs a new Rental object with all necessary details such as the rental date, user information, vehicle ID, start and end locations, rental duration, and malfunction status.
      Parameters:
      rentalDateTime - Date and time of the rental
      userName - Name of the user renting the vehicle
      rentalVehicleId - ID of the rented vehicle
      startLocation - Starting location of the vehicle
      endLocation - Ending location of the vehicle
      rentalDuration - Duration of the rental in seconds
      hasMalfunction - Indicates if the vehicle has a malfunction
      hasPromotion - Indicates if the rental has a promotion applied

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the vehicle simulation in a separate thread, handling movement from the start to end location while updating the map in real time.
      The method performs the following steps:
      1. Finds the vehicle by its ID and places it on the map at the starting position.
      2. Calculates the steps required to reach the destination and pauses between steps to simulate real-time movement.
      3. Updates the vehicle's position on the map step by step, using JavaFX's `Platform.runLater()` to ensure the GUI is updated correctly.
      4. If a malfunction occurs, the vehicle moves only three steps before stopping.
      5. Monitors battery level during movement and recharges if necessary.
      6. Upon reaching the destination, the vehicle is removed from the map and the rental is marked as complete.
      7. Generates a receipt and updates discount eligibility based on the number of rentals.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      See Also:
      • Ensures that map updates occur on the correct thread.
      • Reduces the vehicle's battery level after each step of movement.
      • Used to interact with the GUI map for vehicle visualization.

    • updateDiscount

      public void updateDiscount(String userName)
      Updates the discount eligibility for the user based on their rental count.
      Parameters:

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Checks if this `Rental` is equal to another object. Two rentals are considered equal if they have the same rental date and time and vehicle ID.
